text: Juan Viedma Castillo (born February 6, 1970 in Barcelona) is a track and field athlete from Spain. He has a disability: He is blind and a T12/F12/B2 type athlete. He competed at the 1992 Summer Paralympics in the 100 meter B2 race. He competed at the 1996 Summer Paralympics. He finished first in the F12 triple jump. He finished third in the long jump. He competed at the 2000 Summer Paralympics. He finished third in the 4 X 100 meter T11-T13 race. He competed at the 2004 Summer Paralympics. == References == Category:Spanish long jumpers Category:Living people Category:1970 births Category:Paralympic gold medalists for Spain Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Spain Category:1992 Summer Paralympics Category:1996 Summer Paralympics Category:2000 Summer Paralympics Category:2004 Summer Paralympics Category:Sportspeople with disabilities, type T12 Category:Sportspeople with disabilities, type B2 Category:Sportspeople from Barcelona Category:Spanish triple jumpers
title: Juan Viedma Castillo
